page.title: 19CHIRNSIDE:PEARLIN JEAN
page.content: One of the most interesting ghost stories must be that of Pearlin Jean of Allanbank. There are several versions of the story but this is the most well-known. In the early 1700s Allanbank House, near Allanton, was owned by a Sir Robert Stuart who was rather a wild person. Sir Robert travelled a great deal and, once, on a trip to France, he met and fell in love with a girl named Jeanne who was very beautiful, but unfortunately not wealthy. He brought her back to Allanbank but would not marry her as she wasn't rich. The villagers gave her the name Pearlin Jean as she wore a lot of lace, and the old Scots word for lace was pearlin. A baby girl was born to them, and they appeared happy. Then, on a visit to Edinburgh, Sir Robert met and married a wealthy lady.
